data.title: Interesting Edmond
data.text: When we walked in, we were greeted by a kind and informative gentleman who is down-to-earth and who brings Edmond's history to life.  While we didn't get to enjoy the live history performance (those are scheduled events at schools and other times of the year), we did gain insightful and fun information.  If we had young children with us, this would be a good place for kids to explore since there is an area for them to learn at their level.  Actually, this museum has something of interest for all ages.

data.title: This is a good small museum that offers a great place to take younger kids for hands on Edmond history
data.text: Our family has visited this museum many times to learn some history about Edmond and for my child to play in the small town street built just for kids.  I have also taken several other children here and they enjoyed the town just for kids and the historical movies that were being shown.  I would go back there again with my daughter and her friends.

data.title: A Quiet Gem
data.text: It's a great place to explore if you're new to Edmond.  It also has a great children's section, and please, it's free!

data.title: You must stop in if you are new to Edmond or just visiting
data.text: The Edmond Historical Museum is a great place to stop in and see the current historical displays, see some exhibits about the early days of Edmond, and ask the staff questions about the city. I've purchased a book at the store, and would like to return to buy more. The museum often has events for the public (Including book signings), and activities for the kids. We've had several Scouting events here, and the staff was great!

data.title: Great history of Edmond
data.text: Lots of information in this museum, you could send an hour or hours just depending on if you want to read and learn about everything. They also have a small gift some with fun suviners. Worth checking out!

data.title: Fantastic and free
data.text: If you have young kids, this place is a surprising gem.  An old fashioned town in the back with a market, farm, teepee, bank, store and train provides a great play place for young children (babies to young elementary school).  There's a park next to the museum with fun things to climb and picnic tables.

data.title: Get to know about Edmond!
data.text: Fun little stop to see some of Edmonds history. You can also pick up a walking tour map of Edmond as well. I would recommend taking the walking tour in the spring or fall.

data.title: My grandgirl just loved the back area where she put on boots, hat, and grabbed a money bag!  So fun!
data.text: It is a small but good museum. We toured very quickly but had to stay for the kid area! We just loved loved loved that area.  That made the trip worth it all!  It is a short event, although graddaughter (age 5)  would have stayed longer! A camera is a must when you get the kiddos dressed up in old western gear!

data.title: Fascinating, if new to Edmond
data.text: They also have news archives for local history, nice museum. My son at 10 loved it. The indoor western village was clever.

data.title: Excellent history of Edmond
data.text: As a visitor I was not sure what we would find but thought it would be nice to visit the Edmond museum.  It was a pleasant surprise and a learning experience.  As a family we enjoyed learning of Edmonds History and the displays and artifacts were very intriguing. I would recommend a visit to this very quaint facility.

data.title: Good place for kids to play
data.text: I liked that there was a place for the children to act out life from  100 years ago. A bank, store, garden, and tee pee, and frontier home make it a good place for children to explore and play.

data.title: learning made fun!
data.text: Edmond Historical Society has a cute little museum for the kiddos and is right next door to Stephenson park for some play time after.  Check out their website for a schedule of special events.  My daughter's all time favorite summer activity is attending their 3 day 1889ers school.

data.title: Wonderful Museum
data.text: This museum is a great place to learn about Edmond and the curator, Deborah, knows her stuff and is very helpful in explaining things.

data.title: Local man
data.text: To see all the wonderful memories of childhood, family and the staff is very nice.  The variety in sections and special sections periodically makes me come by more then once.

data.title: A very neat museum documenting the history of the city of Edmond.
data.text: The museum is put together well and very nice.  It shows the history of Edmond and has some neat artifacts.

data.title: History and Genealogy in on a quiet space!
data.text: In a nice area of Edmond-restuarants close by and a good exhibit all the time.  Small but helpful genealogy library with internet access and Ancestry access.  Nice little half day trip!

data.title: حديث
data.text: لقد قمت بزيارته اكثر من مره مع الاهل ومرة اخري مع الاصحاب لشدة اعجابي الكبير جدا بديكور المكان والتنظيم المميز
